{"step_by_step_thinking": "The eutectic mixture of 2.5% lignocaine and 2.5% prilocaine is commonly referred to as EMLA, as mentioned in multiple documents. This mixture is used as a topical anesthetic, which means it is applied to the surface of the body and not injected. Therefore, it would not be used for nerve blocks or intrapulpal anesthesia, which require injection. Document [18] mentions that EMLA has been used on oral mucosa, indicating that it can be used to anesthetize intact mucosa.", "answer_choice": "D"}
